uas.lntv.pacmangame.Screens

Class MapScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • uas.lntv.pacmangame.Screens.MapScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameScreen, MenuScreen, PauseScreen, ScoreScreen, SettingsScreen

    public abstract class MapScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    Abstract class for almost every screen, that will be used in our PacManGame. (Except of the SplashScreen)

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapScreen

        public MapScreen(PacManGame game,
                 Assets assets,
                 java.lang.String path,
                 MapScreen.Type type)
        Abstract constructor, that creates the screens depending on the type of screen with all the basic features that are needed in every screen.
        Parameters:
        game - the running PacManGame
        assets - the assets manager
        path - the path to the map that needs to be loaded for the screen
        type - the type of screen

    • Method Detail

      • getGhosts

        public java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> getGhosts()

      • getHud

        public Hud getHud()

      • getMap

        public Map getMap()

      • getPacman

        public PacMan getPacman()

      • handleInput

        protected boolean handleInput()
        Detects, if a key on the keyboard has been pressed (Desktop version) or if the Controller has been used on the touchscreen of the mobile application.
        Returns:
        true if there has been action

      • switchMusicGame

        protected void switchMusicGame()
        Turns hunting music off and starts the game music from the point where it has been stopped, when the hunter item was eaten. This method is called, after the buff time of the hunter item expired.

      • switchMusicHunting

        protected void switchMusicHunting()
        Switches the game music to the hunting music. It's called when PacMan ate a cherry-coin.

      • activateBuff

        public void activateBuff(Tile.Item buffType)
        Empty method that's only used in GameScreen
        Parameters:
        buffType - the type of buff

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        This method is called, when the screen is closed. It disposes all disposable instances, that have been created and stops the running music of the current screen.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • notReady

        public void notReady()
        This method is called, when a new level starts or when PacMan dies. It resets the 'home' status of the ghosts and tells the game, that the player is not ready yet until he starts the game by using the controls for moving.

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        This method renders the screen. It draws the map, new state of PacMan and the ghosts and also the position of the joystick, if used.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Parameters:
        delta - time parameter used by libGDX

      • resize

        public void resize(int width,
                   int height)
        Method, that's automatically called when resizing the screen.
        Specified by:
        resize in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Parameters:
        width - new width
        height - new height

      • update

        public void update(float dt)
        Checks the state of the game and updates the textures and positions of the sprites. This method is always called in the render-methods of the child classes.
        Parameters:
        dt - time parameter used by libGDX

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Specified by:
        hide in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Specified by:
